intro: Rudgea parquioides var. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered rudgea, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
